summary:
Tribology (friction and wear) and materials expert with 35+ years experience in industrial and academic research and development.
I have always walked on the border between industry and academia and find it fascinating to put science into practice. My specialist expertise is in tribology, including macro-, nano- and bio-tribology, materials science & technology, and coatings & surface treatments.
I have wide-ranging application experience in e.g. medical, home healthcare and personal care device development, consumer electronics, semiconductors and manufacturing. R&D leadership at Philips, and as Steve Franklin Consultancy at companies such as ASML, Johnson & Johnson and ThermoFisher Scientific. I have also led a research group at ARCNL (Advanced Research Center in NanoLithography), and have a large industrial and university network.
Ph.D. in Metallurgy/Materials Technology, B.Sc. 1st class hons. in Applied Physics & Materials Science.
Visiting Professor at the University of Sheffield (UK) and at the University of Amsterdam (NL).
Skills in industry-academic bridge-forming, translation of business needs to research questions, leadership of professionals, R&D coordination, project leadership, research proposals, technical coaching, training & lecturing, expert witness, technical editing of publications.
50+ scientific journal publications, 14+ patents.
ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9124-0488;
Research Gate: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Steve-Franklin-3

authors.headline: Tribology & Materials Technology

profile_positions.description: Visiting Professor in tribology within the Soft Matter Group, van der Waals-Zeeman Institute, University of Amsterdam. This is a part-time position in which I give advice on research and applications of that research that involve tribology, and assist in the mentoring of PhD students. In general, the Soft Matter group uses advanced experimental techniques to unravel the relations between microscopic structure and macroscopic functionality of soft matter, which includes human tissue.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Professor

profile_positions.description: PhD advisor, guest lectures and workshops, industrial advisory boards, industry-academic collaborations. Main areas: tribology, biotribology, surface engineering.
profile_positions.title: Royal Academy of Engineering Visiting Industrial Professor

profile_positions.description: Pre-patent technology and industry stakeholders assessment for a new Carbon-based tribological coating
profile_positions.title: Technical Consultancy via Steve Franklin Consultancy

profile_positions.description: Advanced Research Center for Nanolithography (ARCNL) is a scientific research institute with relevance to key technologies in nanolithography. ARCNL is a public-private partnership between the semiconductor equipment company ASML, the University of Amsterdam, the VU University Amsterdam, and the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO). The research activities of the Contact Dynamics group are aimed at providing fundamental understanding of the mechanisms underpinning friction, friction changes over time and friction variability, as affected by wear phenomena, at forces, scales and other preconditions relevant to present and future nanolithography technology. This includes the generation and dynamic behaviour of wear particles and their influence on the subsequent wear and friction, and the study of the tribology, tribochemistry and mechanics of contacts at nano- and multi-asperity level.
profile_positions.title: Group Leader Contact Dynamics
